title.value: TutteNet: Injective 3D Deformations by Composition of 2D Mesh Deformations
title.justification: The title explicitly mentions the main topic of the paper - the TutteNet model for 3D deformations using 2D mesh compositions.
title.quote: TutteNet: Injective 3D Deformations by Composition of 2D Mesh Deformations

extractions.description: This paper introduces a novel method for injective 3D deformations by leveraging the composition of 2D mesh-based deformations. The method, TutteNet, aims to overcome inaccuracies and inefficiencies in current methods by ensuring injectivity in deformations and integrating into optimization and learning frameworks. TutteNet is shown to outperform other injective methods and maintains the integrity of deformations across different applications like NeRF and SDF deformations.

type.justification: The paper details experiments and comparisons with other models to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed TutteNet model.
type.quote: We show through experiments that our method can be used both for accurately learning injective deformations...

name.justification: The paper focuses on 3D deformations and their application in rendering and reconstructing 3D models, which is a common focus in computer vision research.
name.quote: This work concerns computation and learning of 3D deformations.

name.justification: The core focus of the paper is on 3D deformation techniques, particularly using 2D mesh compositions for injective mappings.
name.quote: This work concerns computation and learning of 3D deformations.

name.justification: The application of TutteNet includes deformations of Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs), which are mentioned as a primary use case.
name.quote: A key motivating example for this work is the deformation of Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs).

name.justification: TutteNet is the proposed model in the paper for achieving 3D injective deformations through layers of 2D mesh deformations.
name.quote: We show through experiments that our method can be used both for accurately learning injective deformations...

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces TutteNet as a novel method for 3D injective deformations.
is_contributed.quote: We propose a novel computational representation for 3D injective deformations, which combines the geometric representation of mesh-based deformations...

is_executed.justification: The model was explicitly tested and compared against existing methods through experiments detailed in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We show through experiments that our method can be used both for accurately learning injective deformations...

is_compared.justification: The paper includes empirical comparisons between TutteNet and other methods such as RealNVP and NeuralODE.
is_compared.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

referenced_paper_title.justification: TutteNet utilizes concepts from Generative Escher Meshes which is referenced in the related works.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Generative Escher Meshes. arXiv preprint arXiv:2309.14564, 2023.

name.justification: i-ResNet is one of the models compared to TutteNet within the paper.
name.quote: i-ResNet [6] achieves invertibility of a ResNet by enforcing Lipschitz bounds...

is_contributed.justification: i-ResNet is mentioned as a pre-existing method for comparison purposes.
is_contributed.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

is_executed.justification: i-ResNet was part of the empirical evaluations and comparison experiments with TutteNet.
is_executed.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

is_compared.justification: i-ResNet was numerically compared to TutteNet in experiments.
is_compared.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for i-ResNet is listed in the references section as it details the model's capabilities and applications.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Invertible residual networks. In International conference on machine learning, pages 573–582. PMLR, 2019.

name.justification: RealNVP is also one of the models compared to TutteNet for learning injective deformations.

is_contributed.justification: RealNVP is pre-existing and used for comparison, not contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

is_executed.justification: RealNVP was executed as part of the experiments comparing it with TutteNet.
is_executed.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

is_compared.justification: The performance of RealNVP is numerically compared with TutteNet results.
is_compared.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is referenced alongside its original paper for background information.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Density estimation using real nvp. arXiv preprint arXiv:1605.08803, 2016.

name.justification: NeuralODE is another existing model used for comparison with TutteNet.
name.quote: NeuralODE [10] have also been successfully applied to 3D deformations...

is_contributed.justification: NeuralODE is used for comparative analysis and was not a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

is_executed.justification: NeuralODE was executed and compared in the experiments detailed in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

is_compared.justification: NeuralODE is compared numerically with TutteNet in the study's experiments.
is_compared.quote: We empirically evaluate and compare to these methods in Section 4.2.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The foundational paper for NeuralODE is referenced as it serves as a basis for comparison in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Neural ordinary differential equations. Advances in neural information processing systems, 31, 2018.

name.justification: The SMPL model is used to generate datasets for training and testing the proposed TutteNet model's effectiveness in learning deformations.
name.quote: We evaluate the applicability of TutteNet in a learning setting...we choose to use the highly popular SMPL [51] model.

referenced_paper_title.value: SMPL: A skinned multi-person linear model
referenced_paper_title.justification: The SMPL model paper is referenced in the text when discussing datasets used for experiments.
referenced_paper_title.quote: SMPL: A skinned multi-person linear model. ACM Trans. Graphics (Proc. SIGGRAPH Asia), 34(6):248:1–248:16, 2015.

name.justification: The AMASS dataset is used in experiments to evaluate the TutteNet model's performance on human deformation learning tasks.
name.quote: ... pose source/target pairs from the AMASS dataset [53] ...

referenced_paper_title.value: AMASS: Archive of motion capture as surface shapes
referenced_paper_title.justification: The AMASS dataset is utilized in the paper for experiments and its reference provides the original source information.
referenced_paper_title.quote: AMASS: Archive of motion capture as surface shapes. In International Conference on Computer Vision, pages 5442–5451, 2019.
